definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: The smoke grew thicker and I could see flames all around.
sentences.chinese: 烟雾越来越浓，四处火舌冲天。

sentences.english: The name Sabancaya means “tongue of fire” in the Quechua Indian language.
sentences.chinese: 在克丘亚印地安语中，萨班卡亚是“火舌”的意思。

sentences.english: In the scene turns the large flame often gushes out to the window outside.
sentences.chinese: 火场内翻起的火舌不时地向窗外涌出。

sentences.english: Tongues of flame leaped up the stairway.
sentences.chinese: 火舌沿楼梯迅速向上蔓延。

sentences.english: Only a couple of hours later, the blaze had quickly spread to the neighboring Heilongjiang Province.
sentences.chinese: 仅仅几小时后，火舌便迅速窜到了临近的黑龙江省。

sentences.english: The long flames sang their drumming chorus in voices of the heaviest bass.
sentences.chinese: 长长的火舌呼呼地用最低的音唱出悲壮的歌。

sentences.english: The flames are licking out of windows.
The flame was carried in a special metal canister.
sentences.chinese: 火舌被放置在一个特殊的金属罐中。

sentences.english: A yellow tongue of flame shot upwards.
sentences.chinese: 一条黄色的火舌直冲上天。

definition: stream of water (as from a fountain or a faucet)/jet of water
spout/spray/belch/to well up/to puff out/to spurt out
